@Janni_Joy @paul_stokes39 @JenniGoldsmith @GMB @herbivore_club Great to know, I LOVE hearing people's experiences and strategies. I work hard during the day and take the evenings off, and I talk to my friends on the phone every day. But I miss home so much, I am pushing myself a bit so I can wrap this up and go back to Vancouver.
@TheOnlyEdAsner https://t.co/De86HA2I3m
@DavidFutrelle Cats: "Oh yeah? Go ahead. We ARE Corporate."

@Janni_Joy @paul_stokes39 @JenniGoldsmith @GMB @herbivore_club Thank you. I think I've found a balance. It was unbelievably difficult for a few weeks, I was so scattered and super-anxious. But the past few days I've been much more calm and focused.

RT @PaulLeeTicks: With all those Big Macs at the White House - the Hamburglar can't be TOO far behind ;)
#SarahHuckabeeSandBurglar https:/â€¦
@Janni_Joy @paul_stokes39 @JenniGoldsmith @GMB @herbivore_club Thank you my dear. I really appreciate it. :) I am smiling a bit again too.
@adrienneleigh @GMB @herbivore_club I hear ya. Like I said, I don't want to re-traumatise people.

@adrienneleigh @GMB @herbivore_club I don't want to re-traumatise people. But I also don't think that we should reject outright any means of exposing unjust practices, even if they are profoundly ugly. That we acknowledge it is so traumatising merely underscores the urgency.

@adrienneleigh @GMB @herbivore_club I believe it's profoundly damaging to insulate consumers, which allows the harms to be magnified - not only to animals but also to feedlot workers - and takes away any opportunity for consumers to take responsibility. 2/2

@adrienneleigh @GMB @herbivore_club I think that showing the truth about factory farming is actually empowering, not traumatising. For 99% of human history, people had a direct relationship with the animals they ate. 1/2
